intro: Jatropha sotoi-nunyezii, commonly known as the Sotoi-Nunyezii physic nut, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and toxic sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain toxic seeds. Due to its toxicity, it is not commonly cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
